alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Espanola Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 8:20AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RAPID SNOWMELT LEADING TO EXCESSIVE RUNOFF IN THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS OF NEW MEXICO... Near to above seasonal temperatures over the northern mountains continue to drive rapid snowmelt and runoff. Creeks and rivers in and near the northern New Mexico mountains will continue to experience higher flows and variability in water levels due to daily temperatures changes. Mountain roads may experience localized flooding. HAZARD...Elevated water levels and flows in creeks and rivers. Localized flooding possible especially over low water crossings. IMPACT...Potential for impassable roads. Locations impacted include... All rivers and creeks in and near the northern mountains including the Sangre de Cristo and Tusas mountains as well as all northern tributaries of the Rio Grande. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Exercise extreme caution near cold, fast flowing water and river banks. Do not drive through flooded roadways. Be wary of rock and mudslides in steep locations.
